title: Open Firefox tabs will not refresh once connected to VPN
content:
Hello. Periodically I need to connect to my employer's VPN. Whenever I do, all of the open tabs in Firefox will not refresh or connect to new websites. This is especially troublesome for pages that refresh periodically like when viewing email. New tabs open webpages fine. I have tried using a "hard reload" (Shift while using the Reload button) on the already-open tabs as well as clearing the cache through the Settings menu. I've also tried changing the proxy settings in Network settings (Configure Proxy Access to the Internet; No proxy, Auto-detect proxy settings for this network, Use system proxy settings, Manual proxy configuration)

Any ideas on how to prevent this problem in the first place or fix it when it happens?

Thanks

title: Link Externo do Aliexpress Bloqueado - Conta do BOL
content:
Olá a todos.

Recebo diariamente E-mails do Aliexpress com propagandas onde tem as imagens das ofertas com os respectivos links. Quando clico em uma das imagens com o link externo recebo uma mensagem de "Link Externo Bloqueado" conforme foto em anexo. Parou de funcionar em E-mails antigos que o link funcionava normalmente. Qualquer outro link externo de qualquer outro email e ou loja funciona normalmente. Tenho um conhecimento até avançado de informática. Veja as minhas ações para tentar resolver o problema, mas que não deram resultado. Fiz o teste no Edge, Google Chrome e Mozilla Firefox e problema se apresenta nos 3 navegadores. Então conclui que o problema é de atualização do Windows10, ou de configuração do E-mail. Identifiquei duas atualizações a KB5041355 instalada dia 09/08/2024 e a KB5034441 instalada dia 04/08/2024. Tentei desinstalar e após a reinicialização elas estão lá novamente. Não tenho anti vírus instalado e desativei o "Firewall e Proteção de Rede" do Windows, desativei "Proteção contra Vírus e Ameaças". Já tentei inscerir excessões em tudo que é lugar que conheço e mesmo assim o link externo somente do Aliexpress está bloqueado.

Espero que alguém possa me ajudar.

Att. Evandro

Identifiquei duas atualizações de segurança
creator: microbit

title: Help with broken install/transferring passwords from old profile
content:
My Firefox install apparently did a background update that did not complete, I get an error 'XULRunner / Error: Platform version '129.0' is not compatible...'

I did not (do not) have a profile I had logged into for that installation, but did have many passwords saved that I'd like to still be able to use if at all possible.

I have installed another instance of Firefox that is working (on platform 129.0), and am using Windows 11. I also turned off automatic updates in hopes of preventing this in the future.

The previous profile still exists in AppData/Roaming, but I don't know how/if I can connect it to the new installation I now have.

Is it possible to either fix the incomplete update or connect my old profile to this new instance so I don't have to reset all my passwords?

Thanks!

title: I'm having trouble accessing [website name] on Firefox.
content:
Hi there,

I'm sorry to hear you're having trouble accessing [website name] on Firefox. Here are a few steps you can try to resolve the issue:

Clear Cache and Cookies: Sometimes, old cache and cookies can cause problems with loading websites. Go to Firefox’s menu, select "Settings," then navigate to "Privacy & Security," and under "Cookies and Site Data," click "Clear Data."

Check for Extensions: Some extensions might interfere with website functionality. Try disabling your extensions one by one to see if any of them are causing the issue. You can do this by going to the menu, selecting "Add-ons and themes," and then disabling each extension.

Update Firefox: Ensure you’re using the latest version of Firefox. Updates often include bug fixes and improvements that might resolve your issue. Check for updates by going to the menu, selecting "Help," and then "About Firefox."

Disable Hardware Acceleration: Occasionally, hardware acceleration can cause display issues. Go to the menu, select "Settings," then "General," scroll down to "Performance," and uncheck "Use recommended performance settings." You can then uncheck "Use hardware acceleration when available."

Try Safe Mode: Firefox’s Safe Mode can help determine if the problem is related to your current settings or extensions. Restart Firefox in Safe Mode by going to the menu, selecting "Help," and then "Restart with Add-ons Disabled."

Check for Known Issues: Sometimes, there are known compatibility issues or bugs with specific websites. Check the Firefox Support site or forums to see if others are experiencing similar issues with [website name].

Try a Fresh Profile: Creating a new Firefox profile can help if there are issues with your current profile. You can create a new profile by typing about: profiles in the address bar and following the instructions.

If you’ve tried all these steps and the issue persists, please provide more details about the problem you’re experiencing, such as error messages or specific parts of the site that aren’t working. This information can help further diagnose the issue. [[click here|https://beyondgroup.ae/]].

Here’s what I’ve tried so far:

Checked server resource utilization and logs Reviewed application code for potential issues Verified database connections and configurations Despite these efforts, the issue persists. I’m looking for advanced troubleshooting tips or any specific tools that can help diagnose and resolve this issue. Screenshots and log excerpts are attached for further context.

Thanks in advance.

I have a fibre connection, I am definitely connected! I have tried everything I can find to remedy this problem but nothing works, for example a flush DNS command. This has been happening for over a year now and it is absolutely driving me insane. Whenever this happens I can open another browser and will have none of these problems with that browser. I have been using Firefox for over 20 years religiously, but I am getting so sick of this that if I don't find a solution for this problem soon I will be done with Firefox, I don't even know why I've persisted with this problem for so long. Please help!!!

title: Ignores don't autoupdate setting and resets it to autoupdate on reload
content:
This is a persistent issue for many a version. I've tried these config settings too and it still consistently-inconsistent resets it sometimes. app.update.auto (->false) app.update.auto.migrated (->false) app.update.enabled (->false) app.update.service.enabled (->false) DisableAppUpdate (->true)

It does this on closing hanging browser or on system power off (without closing browser manually). Also if setting is set to don't update -> close browser within a minute -> when reopened it is on autoupdate again.
